metadata.title: CVE-2015-3240 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The pluto IKE daemon in libreswan before 3.15 and Openswan before 2.6.45,when built with NSS, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(assertion failure and daemon restart) via a zero DH g^x value in a KEpayload in a IKE packet.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3240` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libreswan - 3.19-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libreswan package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.19-1').
